titles.title: A joint resolution proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the United States to prohibit any Member of Congress sentenced for conviction of a felony during a session of Congress from continuing to serve as a Member of such Congress after the date of such sentencing.

action.text: Referred to House Committee on The Judiciary.
Referred to Subcommittee on Civil and Constitutional Rights.

bill.summary: 1/6/1987--Introduced. Constitutional Amendment - Prohibits any Member of Congress sentenced during any Congress for violation of any State or Federal law which is punishable by death or by a term of imprisonment exceeding one year from continuing to serve as a Member after the date of sentencing.
